Question I was not expecting when I phoned to book car service; ‘well, has the car told you it *wants* to be serviced?’ So now I have a printer that emails me complaining it doesn’t like its fake cheap ink AND a sentient car.

@robdelaney Increase in marketing spend is, in my understanding, correlated with deregulation errors voted in in last decade by HoC. It’s this that’s hugely boosted the takeover on High Streets and ads, I believe. HUGE impact, as ever, on women’s poverty & men’s MH; https://t.co/wpHL99jGpi

@robdelaney Incredibly uncomfortable with it. A gradual creep, there more subtlely in my childhood too; one of two places men snuck off to or overstayed at that caused trouble; the bookies or the pub. Studied addiction with OU, then it really hit home - it’s all the same devastating illness.

@jessikart It is phenomenal. I really think this type of thing has the power to make huge thought and change. :’-) I’m sitting speechless at the thought of my historical neighbours receiving word, twice in 4 months, that their child had died at war. @typejunky
(19)17. Goodness me.

Wow. Brothers on my street, one died on 23/01/17, the other on 23/04/17, aged 25 and 21 respectively. Both medical students at Edinburgh Uni & sons of the local minister & his wife. I’ll never look at that house and the street in the same way again. Phenomenal use of tech. https://t.co/KiisPbXk4s
